title: ICE: `no name for expr |a|`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
The compiler panics when referencing a captured variable inside a nested closure.

This happens on the playground nightly build "rustc 1.42.0-nightly (ed33453a3 2019-12-25) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu" as well as MSVC stable "stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc updated - rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16)".

This issue feels awfully related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/67252. But from what I gathered, its fix (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/67289) went live a couple of days ago and should be in the playground version 1.42.0-nightly (ed33453a3 2019-12-25).

I tried this code (minimal-ish example):
https://gist.github.com/rust-play/362fc228ed152a41e5b216603e7c236f
```rust
fn main() {
    let _ = vec![0]
        .iter()
        .flat_map(|a| vec![0].iter().map(|_| &a))
        .collect::<Vec<_>>();
}
```

I expected to see this happen: No compiler errors or warnings and especially no crash.

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 73528e339aae0f17a15ffa49a8ac608f50c6cf14
commit-date: 2019-12-16
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.40.0
LLVM version: 9.0

Backtrace (from the playground):

Standard Error

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/hir/map/mod.rs:955: no name for expr |a| <[_]>::into_vec(box [0]).iter().map(|_| &a) (hir_id=HirId { owner: DefIndex(3), local_id: 40 })

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:895:9
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88
   1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:77

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59

             at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1057

             at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1426

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:195

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:215
  10: rustc_driver::report_ice

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:476

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (ed33453a3 2019-12-25) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_borrowck] processing `main::{{closure}}#0`
#1 [mir_borrowck] processing `main`
#2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
